#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=5. Challenges of the OWC in the 5G/6G and IoT Solutions
#Text=A number of challenging issues must be proficiently addressed to deploy the OWC technologies for the 5G/6G and IoT solutions .
#Text=A few important challenging issues are briefly discussed below :
#Text=Frequent handover :
#Text=Future communication systems will consist of heterogeneous small dense networks that will create very frequent handovers .
#Text=A handover will be between optical networks and between optical and RF networks .
#Text=Optical cells are very small and may trigger many unnecessary handovers .
#Text=Avoiding an unnecessary handover and the ping-pong effect is also an important issue .

#Text=The properties of the physical and data-link layers differ in the optical and RF-based wireless networks , thereby bringing about a great challenge for the mobility support in RF/optical hybrid systems .
#Text=Inter-cell interference : Managing the inter-cell optical interference is a serious issue in the deployment of optical VLC and LiFi networks .
#Text=The dense deployment of LEDs for the OWC technologies may create high interference in the 5G/6G and IoT networks .
#Text=Therefore , the inter-cell optical interference is a challenging issue .
#Text=Atmospheric loss : The performance of the OWC technologies is affected by scattering , refraction , air absorption , free space loss , and scintillation of the atmosphere .
#Text=In an outdoor environment , fog and dust obstruct the optical signal from the transmitter to the receiver .
#Text=The communication link quality in the FSO is degraded because of bad atmospheric conditions .
#Text=Hence , the atmospheric loss mitigation is challenging with regard to reaching the goal of the 5GB networks , especially in the outdoor condition .
#Text=Limited uplink communication using OWC technologies : Most of the user equipment is designed with low-power LEDs to reduce the drainage of power .
#Text=Because of the low-power LEDs , VLC and the LiFi cannot perform well in uplink communication .
#Text=Moreover , most of the LEDs of the user equipment produce diffused lights with low power that are easily affected by downlink high-power lights and , hence , limit the uplink communication .
#Text=In addition , a little deflection or movement of the receiver of a user equipment can easily hamper the uplink communication link .
#Text=Hence , this is an important issue to be solved in future to efficiently support uplink communication using VLC and the LiFi systems .
#Text=Low data rate of the OCC system : One of the most important drawbacks of the existing OCC system is the low data rate .
#Text=It is challenging to provide a high data rate because of its low-frame rate cameras .
#Text=The most recently achieved data rate in the OCC system is only 55 Mbps .
#Text=This data rate should be increased to fulfill the demands of services in the 5G/6G and IoT networks .
#Text=Flickering avoidance :
#Text=Flickering is defined as the fluctuations in the brightness of a light that can be noticed by humans .
#Text=This is an important issue in the OWC systems .
#Text=Different modulation schemes on the OWC systems may cause flickering that has a harmful effect on human health .
#Text=The modulation of LEDs should be done in such a manner that flickering is avoided .
#Text=Such is a challenging issue .

#Text=Data rate improvement of the FSO backhaul system : The backhaul systems in the 5G/6G systems have to handle an enormous volume of data traffic to support high-data-rate services at the user level ; otherwise , a bottleneck problem will arise .
#Text=Hence , increasing the FSO backhaul capacity considering the growth of traffic volume is a challenging task .
#Text=Machine learning for OWC :
#Text=Learning-based networking system will be the key requirement in future 6G communication networks .
#Text=The ever-increasing complex network structure and requirements demand artificial controlling and decision-making in challenging environments .
#Text=We can use supervised learning for several OWC-based applications such as smart healthcare , smart home lighting , and OWC data mining .
#Text=OWC data-based analysis , such as correlating , ranking , spatial and temporal analysis , and flow prediction , can be performed more efficiently by unsupervised methods of machine learning .

#Text=Furthermore , we can use reinforcement learning to enhance the data rate , implement network switching and manage network traffic , among other factors , of the ultra-dense OWC networks for 6G .
#Text=Integrating machine learning in 6G OWC networks enables intelligent network assignment , auto error correction , efficient decision making , and network re-assignment , among others .
#Text=Moreover , machine learning approach is a core demand in indoor mobile robot-based dense OWC small networks to perform fast and efficient tasks .
